Column Comment.0: MAPPING IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a mapping between systems.
Column Comment.1: LOAD PROCESS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a loading process in a datamodel.
Column Comment.2: ERROR IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an error that occured during a loadingprocess in a data model.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DELETE ERROR INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this error occurredduring a deletion. Value is (Y) if an error occured duing deletion or (N) if the error didnot occur during a deletion.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: ERROR CAUSE DESCRIPTION: Narrative description of the cause of the error.
Column Comment.7: ERROR CAUSE TYPE: The type of cause that resulted in an error during a loadprocess. Causes are usually defined hierarchically. This column may refer to a causeat any level of the hierarchy.
Column Comment.8: ERROR CODE: the code assigned to the error.
Column Comment.9: ERROR DATE: The date that the error occurred.
Column Comment.10: ERROR MESSAGE: The message that is shown when this error occurs.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: INSERT ERROR INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this error occurredduring an insertion. Value is (Y) if an error occured duing insertion or (N) if the errordid not occur during a insertion.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REFERENCED MAPPING DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique numberidentifying each referenced individual mapping for the systems.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: RESOLUTION DESCRIPTION: Narrative description of the resolution of the error.
Column Comment.17: RESOLUTION TYPE: The type of resolution that corrrected the error that occurredduring a load process.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: UPDATE ERROR INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this error occurredduring an update. Value is (Y) if an error occured duing the update or (N) if the errordid not occur during the update.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALILTY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
